
## Install Podman

- Ubuntu: `sudo apt-get -y install podman`

## Setup Podman

Run below commands one by one

- `sudo apt install qemu-system-x86`  
- `podman machine init`  
- `podman machine start` sometimes not work  
    - `https://stackoverflow.com/questions/72092497/podman-machine-start-on-ubuntu`  
    - `sudo mv /mnt/c/Users/hrith/Downloads/gvproxy-linux-amd64 /usr/libexec/podman`  
- wsl2 has some issue with kvm so you may need to run `sudo chmod 666 /dev/kvm` before running podman machine start  

## Download Images

```bash
podman pull docker.io/library/nginx:latest  # Download from dockerhub
podman pull podman.io/library/alpine:latest # Download from podman

# Check/list downloaded images
podman images

# Delete Downloaded
podman rmi image_name_or_id

```


## Run Image

- `stop & start` are used for to turn on or off pods or  
- `run & rm` are used to create or remove pods

```bash
# 0. List the running/stopped containers
podman ps -a

# 1. Start a new container from an image (run interactively or detached)
podman run nginx
podman run -d --name container_name imagename:tag

# 2. Stop / Shutdown a running container
podman stop container_name_or_id

# 3. Restart the stopped container
podman start container_name_or_id

# 4. Delete the stopped container
podman rm container_name_or_id

# 5. Delete all stopped containers
podman container prune
```

## Some userfull podman commands

```bash
# Port expose
podman run -p host_port:container_port/protocol image_name # -p = --publish
podman run -p 8080-8085:80-85/tcp image_name    # range of ports
podman port container_name_or_id    # Check port mapping of running containers

podman run -v volume_name_or_hostpath:/container/path image_name # mount named volumes to containers




```
